meanings.def: to clean, polish or make something smooth with a brush
examples: brush something to brush your hair/teeth
to brush your shoes
brush something + adj. A tiled floor is easy to brush clean.

meanings.def: to remove or try to remove something from a place or surface with a brush or with your hand
examples: brush something + adv./prep. He brushed the dirt off his jacket.
He pulled out a handkerchief and brushed away the tears.
Gail brushed a strand of hair out of her eyes.
She brushed the fly away.
brush + adv./prep. Lucille brushed at the blood on his jacket.
He brushed the mud from his coat.
She brushed away her tears.
Her hair was brushed back in a pony tail.
She brushed her hair out of her eyes.
I brushed the crumbs off the table.

meanings.def: to put something, for example oil, milk or egg, on something using a brush
examples: brush A with B Brush the pastry with beaten egg.
brush B over, on, etc. A Brush beaten egg over the pastry.

meanings.def: to touch somebody/something lightly while moving close to them/it
examples: brush by/past somebody/something She brushed past him.
brush against somebody/something His hand accidentally brushed against hers.
brush something The leaves brushed her cheek.
brush something with something He brushed her lips with his.
I hardly noticed the man who brushed past me in the corridor.
She brushed by him and dashed up the stairs.
She carefully avoided brushing against the man sitting beside her at the table.

meanings.def: an object made of short stiff hairs (called bristles) or wires set in a block of wood or plastic, usually attached to a handle. Brushes are used for many different jobs, such as cleaning, painting and tidying your hair.
examples: a paintbrush
a hairbrush
a toothbrush
brush strokes (= the marks left by a brush when painting)
a dustpan and brush
Apply the paint with a fine brush.
Remove all the rust with a wire brush.
Scrub the wood thoroughly with water and a stiff brush.
She ran a brush through her hair.
She took a can of paint and dipped her brush in it.
The artist has used tiny brush strokes.
to give your teeth a good brush

meanings.def: a light touch made in passing something/somebody
examples: the brush of his lips on her cheek

meanings.def: a short unfriendly meeting with somebody; an occasion when you nearly experience something unpleasant
examples: She had a nasty brush with her boss this morning.
In his job he's had frequent brushes with death.
a brush with the law

meanings.def: land covered by small trees or bushes
examples: a brush fire

meanings.def: to be thought to have the same faults, etc. as somebody else
to describe something in a general way, ignoring the details

idioms.idiom: be tarred with the same brush (as somebody)
idioms.def: to be thought to have the same faults, etc. as somebody else

idioms.idiom: paint something with a broad brush
idioms.def: to describe something in a general way, ignoring the details
